definition: to present to a superior/memorial/petition/to present (a certain appearance)/to assume (a shape)/to be (a certain color)
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: We defer questions of this kind to the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 我们通常把这类问题呈交主席处理。

sentences.english: A transcript of the tapes was presented as evidence in court.
sentences.chinese: 一份录音带的文字本作为证据被呈交法庭。

sentences.english: Pleadings must be submitted to the court when the action is set down for trail.
sentences.chinese: 当案件确定正式审判后，诉辩状必须呈交法院。

sentences.english: I tided up the report before handing it in.
sentences.chinese: 我把报告整理好再呈交。

sentences.english: He submitted the report to the committee.
sentences.chinese: 他向委员会呈交了一份报告。

sentences.english: A second study presented at the conference backed up the warning.
sentences.chinese: 在年会上呈交的另一份研究报告支持这种警示。

sentences.english: Pleadings must be submitted to the court when the action is set down for trial.
sentences.chinese: 当案件确定正式审判后，诉辩状必须呈交法院。

sentences.english: When completed, this return and declaration shall be submitted to the Chief Electoral Officer.
sentences.chinese: 请将填妥的申报书及声明书向总选举事务主任呈交。

sentences.english: This tender is submitted with the full authority of and on behalf of the Tenderer.
sentences.chinese: 此份标书乃经投标人全权授权呈交。

sentences.english: A proposal on same-sex marriage was submitted to the National People's Congress, China's top legislature body.
sentences.chinese: 同性婚姻议题被呈交全国人民代表大会。

definition: secret documents/abbr. for 機密文件|机密文件
memorial to the emperor (folded in accordion form)
official communication (between gov. offices of equal rank)/report delivered by the head of gov. on affairs of state
